items: Learn how if, elif, and else work in Python
Know how indentation affects code execution

sections.heading: How computers make decisions
paragraphs: Computers can make decisions by checking conditions (true or false statements). In Python, this is done with if statements.

sections.heading: Basic structure
bullets: elif → checks another condition if the first one was false
else → runs only if all previous conditions are false

sections.heading: Example idea (no code yet)
paragraphs: Imagine you’re writing a program for a theme park:
- If age is between 12 and 64 → ticket is $10

sections.heading: Indentation matters
paragraphs: In Python, indentation (spaces at the start of a line) tells Python which code belongs to the if statement. If you forget the indentation, you’ll get an error.

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Make a variable called age and give it a number.
Write an if statement that checks if age is less than 18, and prints "You are a minor."
Add an else statement that prints "You are an adult."
Change age and see how the result changes.
Add an elif for age >= 65 to print "You are a senior citizen."
elif checks another condition if the previous one was false
else runs only if all other conditions are false
Indentation is required in Python to group code

questions.prompt: What does the if statement do in Python?
choices: Makes a decision based on a condition

questions.prompt: In an if statement, what keyword is used for “otherwise if”?
True or False: Indentation is optional in Python.
What will this code print if x = 10? if x > 20: print("Big number") else: print("Small number")
